WRITING.TITLE: When fans eventually return to St Mary's will the club ever consider moving the away fans?
WRITING.TEXT: I've always thought about this option and then coronavirus halted everything and with fans being unable to attend matches right now I've wondered why can't the club move away fans to another area of the stadium when it's safe for people to return again. I tend to sit in Northam and sometimes Itchen South and having the away fans in Northam is frustrating because all it does is drown out the noise from our most vocal supporters in Northam and Itchen North when ideally it would be better to have them merge together. In my opinion the away fans should be moved to Kingsland North (blocks 33-39) and then have the whole of the Northam stand filled with our fans. It would really improve our atmosphere at home. Does anyone else have any thoughts on this or shed any light on whether the club has ever considered this option?
Haha thanks I've amended it. #128077;
I see where your coming from but I just wish that Northam and Itchen North merged together as it would definitely be an improvement.
Exactly what I saw at Wolves and Chelsea home matches this season. Sad to say it but we were outsung completely by their support in those games.

Yeah it's just a thought I've had for awhile that I haven't really seen discussed much so I thought I'd throw it out there to get some other opinions on it. I'm not expecting the club to make such a change anytime soon as I'm sure the money would be put to use on more important things. I respect your view regardless though, thanks.
Well done Che Adams, to score a goal that far out at home against City as well. If only we had fans in the ground it would have blown the roof off at St Mary's!
Incredible performance today, I'm so proud of the players! Well done on Adams getting his debut goal. Such desire and passion to get that result! Up the Saints!
They only mentioned THAT game twice today so there is some improvement!
Agreed there should definitely be one of him. It's a shame as well that he didn't live to see how far we've come over the last 10 years.

I'm glad I'm not the only saints fan that is glad he's gone. For him to openly state he wants to leave the club while still with us to play at a "higher level" when he's a dull and average player just shows what pathetic delusions of grandeur he has. Good riddance to the arrogant prick. Absolutely delighted that we've got KWP though, he'll be such a fine addition to the team.

Uhh man I feel you there, been there plenty of times and still am a couple of times a week. What I did to help deal with this is I changed my habits after work. Instead of playing on my PS4 an hour after work, I read a book for 30 minutes or so, it helps me get to sleep quicker. Also try only playing games a few hours at the weekend only, it's what I do. As for the running try going 2-3 times a week even after a 12 hour day, eat something 30 minutes before you finish (ideally a banana) to give you a boost to do a 20-25 minute run. Always try and set a time so that you go to sleep at like 21:00 or 21:30, etc. Don't try and justify staying up a little longer when your already feeling knackered because you just regret it in the morning. Try this out if you can, it helped me out so much and I hope it can help someone else.

Not really a huge gamer but I do own a PS4 but generally only play 2-3 hours a week on it. I've only got 2 games (Apex Legends and Days Gone) but there there's still plenty of fun to be had on them. Never really bothered with a gaming PC although they do seem pretty popular but expensive too I imagine.
I can't remember the last time we beat Burnley. We seem to lose to them every time.
Fully deserved, proud of them both. It's been coming for awhile now.
That's class, any idea which country this was taken?
Haha yeah I get that however someone else posted an article that states it was Ghana. Appreciate the post though as it gave me a good laugh #128516;

I'm a little disappointed that the club is not willing to let some fans attend a pre season friendly. Brighton let 2500 fans in the Amex for their friendly against Chelsea. I don't see why we couldn't have done the same.

WRITING.TITLE: Do any other fans here feel they'll struggle to get match tickets for next season because they are not a season ticket holder?
WRITING.TEXT: I'm not currently a season ticket holder and I have not had one since the Koeman era and I'm curious to know if anyone else will feel like they'll be excluded from any priority list that will determine which fans can attend matches next season due to limited capacity. I can understand season ticket holders getting full priority over anyone else. However for those of us fans that cannot attend as many games due to pricing and other commitments, or don't have a saints membership card, etc we may struggle to buy a ticket for a game as I'm sure that the whole of next season will likely be limited capacity. I was only able to attend 8 matches last season (7 home, 1 away) but that was with full capacity, however with limited capacity I wouldn't be surprised if I can't attend a game until possibly after Christmas, who knows? Anyone else here in a similar situation or have any thoughts on this at all?
Yes I agree, especially when Pellegrino was in charge! What a useless manager he was and the football was dreadful under him. Hughes was no better either.

I found in previous seasons we struggled to fill the stadium because of how expensive some games can be to attend and sometimes of how bad the performances were particularly at home. Yeah I can see how everyone will be chasing after every available ticket now. I reckon they'll only let about 5000-8000 fans into the ground to be honest.
That sounds about right, I remember reading on the clubs website saying they had about 6k sold so far which means they'll be very few tickets left to offer.

I've been to away games in the past and Liverpool was the furthest away game I went to. Might try a get a ticket for the Manchester or Yorkshire clubs depending on how many tickets they make available. Thanks for your thoughts on this, I appreciate it.

That would be nice if they do that. I buy tickets on general sale at the moment but if getting a membership card helps with priority in tickets then I'd gladly invest in it. Will probably see how the first few games at home with fans in it go first though. Thanks for your insight.

Sadly I think your spot on there. The cheapest and most available ticket I got last season was Spurs home in the FA cup match for only #163;15. Who knows maybe we could push for a good cup run this season.
Gutted we didn't get Portsmouth, damn you Brighton!
https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=Z2_2HEE-SfE Same here, wish this was longer though.
Yes THAT game! Of course it was going to be mentioned and 3 times today I believe. I dread to think what will be said on 25th October this year.

It was very tiresome to watch us play today to be honest. The first 10 minutes were decent but ultimately we just weren't clinical enough and Palace were easily able to sit deep and soak up pressure. Ralph made substitutions too late as well and some of the players need to seriously up their game and get more creative.

Yeah I think it is and I'd love to return to watching football in a stadium again. I support Southampton and I reckon we can get a good 5k-6k fans in our ground even though it will be mostly season ticket holders attending only.
58th minute
Listen to it on BBC Radio Solent. Adam Blackmore and Dave Merrington always do a good commentary of our matches, it's worth tuning in for.

Far too easy for them, were absolutely abysmal right now, we have got to step it up in the 2nd half.

So disappointing tonight, we were just so woeful and we'll struggle against Spurs on Sunday if we play like this. Whatever happened to our class 7 match unbeaten run at the end of last season. We need to up our game right now.
Conceded already, sort it out ffs!
Scrap that, lucky escape there!
Lmfao Romeu welcoming back hojbjerg in style
Che should have smashed that one home!
I've just come to accept the fact that it will get mentioned in every match now.
Danny ings he's one of our own!!!!! Get in there!
Agreed, don't want anyone getting sent off as we'd lose momentum.
The defending today has been absolutely shocking!
I would have but I can't afford one!

1st half we were solid and had great spells of play. Completely collapsed in the 2nd half, the defence was just awful. So disappointing, we have got to seriously up our game or we'll risk getting stuck in a rut!

Pleased we finally beat Burnley and delighted with our first points of the season. However we were lacking in that second half and created very little. Felt quite nervous in the closing stage as I was sure we'd squander points from a winning position like we have done so much previously. Anyway, up the saints!
Come on your reds!

Great strike bertrand!
Should of been 1-0 right there. Walker peters was class there, well done.

Very good game today, well done lads!

The way we conceded right after the equalizer was such a crushing feeling. The fight in the team in the 2nd half was terrific and to snatch a well deserved point right at the death of the match is amazing! Get in!
